title.narrative: Nairobi Summit. High-Level Panel on ICPD.

description.narrative: The objective of a High-Level Panel on ICPD is to ensure implementation by UN member states of women and girls’ fundamental right to decide over their own body. The Panel will contribute to this by ensuring follow-up and follow-through on the commitments made at the Nairobi Summit on the implementation of the ICPD PoA before the 2030-deadline. Full implementation of the ICPD PoA will contribute significantly to lifting especially women and girls out of poverty in LDCs.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Output 3: Maintaining and nurturing multi-stakeholder engagement

Output 3 indicator: The Commission will consist of high-level persons representing the multi-stakeholder nature needed for ensuring the effective follow-up to the Nairobi Summit and its commitments, thereby maintaining the buy-in of the various constituencies

Preserve the integrity of and promote the implementation of the ICPD Programme of Action post the Nairobi Summit, drawing on the Political Declaration adopted at the 52nd session of the UN Commission on Population and Development, that reaffirmed the importance of the ICPD Programme of Action for guiding population and development policies and programmes, within the context of Agenda 2030 and the SDGs, and whereby member states of the UN pledged to undertake further actions to ensure "its full, effective and accelerated implementation", and the Nairobi Statement, which contains the 12 global commitments.

Advance the ICPD Programme of Action's promise of the right to universal access to sexual and reproductive health for all, of women's and girls' empowerment and gender equality, while leaving no one behind, in particular youth as agents of positive change and the eladers of the generation to carry forward the ICPD Programme of Action and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, which was reinforced by the Nairobi Statement.
Output 2: The Nairobi Summit follow-up is linked to multilateral processes (Executive Board, CPD, Beijing+25 and Commission of the Status of Women)

Output 2 indicator: The Commission will advocate for the inclusion of sexual and reproductive health and rights as essential components of the Decade of Action initiative of the UN Secretary-General to advance the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)

Output 1: Momentum generated by the Nairobi Summit towards the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the ICPD Programme of Action is maintained, inter alia through the tracking and monitoring of the commitments.

Output 1 indicator: The Commission provides a multi-stakeholder global platform that, in collaboration with existing national and regional monitoring mechanisms, will support the implementation of the Nairobi Commitments. This will involve multi-stakeholder advocacy at global, regional and national levels, including in preparation of key inter-governmental events.
